definition: lit. the fish and the bear's paw, you can't have both at the same time (idiom, from Mencius); fig. you must choose one or the other/you can't always get everything you want/you can't have your cake and eat it
palm of the hand/sole of the foot/paw/horseshoe/to slap/to hold in one's hand/to wield

lit. the fish and the bear's paw, you can't have both at the same time (idiom, from Mencius); fig. you must choose one or the other/you can't always get everything you want/you can't have your cake and eat it
pinyin: yu2 yu3 xiong2 zhang3 bu4 ke3 jian1 de2

sentences.english: Part four is "Delima Between Fish and Bear"s Paw.
sentences.chinese: 第四部分爲“魚與熊掌之間”。

sentences.english: Mr Obama, it seems, wants it both ways.
sentences.chinese: 奧巴馬似乎想要魚與熊掌兼得。

sentences.english: Yet, at the same time, the BIS wants to eat its cake and have it too.
sentences.chinese: 然而，國際清算銀行其實是在希望能魚與熊掌兼得。

sentences.english: In an equestrian community you get to have your cake and eat it too.
sentences.chinese: 在這樣的馬術社區，你可以魚與熊掌兼得。

sentences.english: You can't have your cake and eat it, too.
sentences.chinese: 因爲你不能魚與熊掌兼得。

sentences.english: You know, you can't have one without the other in a way, you know.
sentences.chinese: 在某種程度上，魚與熊掌不可兼得。

sentences.english: Putin has already indicated that Kiev can’t pursue both goals.
sentences.chinese: 普京早就道明，基輔不能魚與熊掌兼得。

sentences.english: I think not keep fish and bear's paw , which must make a choice.
sentences.chinese: 我想，魚與熊掌不可兼得，這必須作出選擇。

sentences.english: You can't have it both ways. You must decide on one or the other.
sentences.chinese: 魚與熊掌兩者不能兼得，你必須選擇其一。

definition: mutually related karma (idiom); fates are intertwined/interdependent
plethora of things to tackle/multitude of loose ends/very complicated/chaotic
lit. the river that divides Chu and Han/fig. a line that divides rival territories/the mid-line between sides on a Chinese chessboard
to take the big picture into consideration (idiom)/to work for the benefits of all
to patch up one's lie (when inconsistencies appear)/to cover (for sb who has lied)
to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
lit. neither a relative nor a friend (idiom)/fig. unrelated to one another in any way
lit. quick sword cuts through tangled hemp (idiom); decisive action in a complex situation/cutting the Gordian knot
out of ammunition and no food left (idiom); in desperate straits
